business.headline: EPFO 3.0 launch date announced: Check ATM withdrawal feature, other detailsEPFO 3.0, launching by June 2025, will offer ATM-based withdrawals, flexible contributions, and improved features, transforming retirement fund management.

Explained: Why Union Bank share price tumbled 7% after Q3 updateUnion Bank stock price: The decline followed a weak quarter-on-quarter (Q-o-Q) performance in its Q3 update. By 1:09 pm, the stock was trading 6.69% lower at Rs 115.75 on the BSE.

Capital Infra Trust IPO: Check latest GMP, price band, and key datesCapital Infra Trust InvIT IPO: The IPO allotment is scheduled for January 10, 2025, with refunds expected to be processed by January 13. Shares will likely be credited to demat accounts on the same day, and the listing is anticipated on January 14 on the BSE and NSE.

ITR filing: 5 new tax regime features every taxpayer must knowBudget 2024's revamped tax regime offers simplified slabs, higher deductions, and savings up to Rs 17,500 annually, enhancing flexibility and easing tax compliance for taxpayers.

Saregama India share price surges over 20% in 5 days. Should you buy or avoid?Saregama India stock price opened at Rs 537.95 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and climbed to an intraday high of Rs 593 before stabilising around Rs 568 at 12:27 PM, up 3% for the day.
Budget 2025: 7 ways government can boost employmentAs the budget approaches, several measures have been proposed to boost job creation and improve productivity.

Explained: Why ITC share price fell by 6% todayITC stock price: ITC hotels demerger process begins. A special pre-open session was conducted on the stock exchanges between 9:00 AM and 9:45 AM to determine ITC Hotels' share price.
Do banks owe you money? Check unclaimed deposits via UDGAM portalRBI (Reerve Bank of India) launched the Unclaimed Deposits – Gateway to Access Information (UDGAM) portal in August 2023.
Sensex, Nifty open higher driven by IT stocks; Titan gains 2% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 254.19 points to 79,477.30, while NSE Nifty50 gained 61.50 points to 24,066.25 as of 9:23 AM.

Standard Glass Lining IPO opens today: Check latest GMP, price band, key detailsStandard Glass Lining IPO price band is set at Rs 133-140 per share, with a lot size of 107 shares. Retail investors must invest at least Rs 14,980.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 9 killed as Naxals blow up vehicle carrying security personnel in ChhattisgarhNaxals on Monday blew up a vehicle carrying District Reserve Guard (DRG) personnel on Kutru Road in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district.

Karnataka's 'mask in public' HMPV advisory after 2 cases in Bengaluru, 1 in Gujarat  Live UpdatesThree babies, a three-month-old and an eight-month-old, in Bengaluru and a two-month-old boy in Ahmedabad have been detected with respiratory distress-causing HMPV.

Prashant Kishor sent to judicial custody after he refuses conditional bailA team of Patna Police "forcibly removed" strategist-turned-politician Prashant Kishor from Patna's Gandhi Maidan, where he was sitting on a fast unto death over the BPSC exam cancellation demand.

Indians can soon renew H-1B visas without returning to IndiaThe US Department of State has successfully completed a pilot programme to renew H-1B visas in the United States and is set to set up a US-based visa rewewal programme this year.

Will HMPV cause new pandemic after Covid-19? What you should knowIndia has detected three cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), a respiratory virus similar to Covid-19 that spreads through droplets and affects vulnerable groups.

Atishi gets emotional, slams BJP's Ramesh Bidhuri over 'changed her father' remarkDelhi Chief Minister Atishi broke down during a press briefing over BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri's remark that "she changed her father". Bidhuri, the BJP's candidate for the Kalkaji Assembly constituency, made the remark on Sunday.

Justin Trudeau to resign? How did Canada get here?Canadian PM Justin Trudeau is under growing pressure from within his own Liberal Party to step down as its leader. Speculation is swirling that Trudeau could announce his resignation as early as this week. But how did Justin Trudeau and Canada come to this point?

IIM-Bangalore student falls to death from hostel after celebrating 29th birthdayA 29-year-old IIM-Bangalore student fell to his death from the second floor of his hostel building hours after he celebrated his birthday with his friends. A case of unnatural death was registered.

Following the circulation of her pictures and videos online, fans began speculating about her possible engagement to boyfriend Tom Holland.

Congress's 'Pyari Didi' scheme for women to counter AAP ahead of Delhi pollsDelhi Election: The Congress has announced a women-oriented scheme called Pyari Didi Yojana and promised to give Rs 2,500 to the women of Delhi if it wins the upcoming Assembly polls.

Governor Ravi vs MK Stalin again, now over 'insulting national anthem, assembly'The Tamil Nadu assembly's winter session began with Governor RN Ravi walking out over alleged disrespect to the National Anthem. Chief Minister MK Stalin, DMK leaders condemned Ravi's action, saying this had become a habit with the Governor.

With PM Modi's 'aapda' jibe, BJP has joined the Delhi dangal against AAPAAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal, the master of narrative building, is now facing a narrative set by PM Modi and the BJP. Kejriwal and the AAP have been cornered by the BJP over allegations of mismanagement in the "extravagant renovation" of the former Delhi CMs bungalow.

Babar Azam 'disappointed' with not finishing his innings well in Cape Town TestStar Pakistan batter Babar Azam revealed that he was left disappointed after not being able to finish his innings well during the second Test against South Africa in Cape Town.

Rohit Sharma-Virat Kohli conundrum: Can India afford to delay tough calls? India's Border-Gavaskar Trophy defeat raises urgent questions about the Test futures of stalwarts Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. While coach Gautam Gambhir downplays the need for immediate change, can India afford to delay tough decisions ahead of the crucial England tour?

All Rounder Rishi Dhawan announces retirement from Indian white-ball cricketIndia and Himachal Pradesh all-rounder Rishi Dhawan announced his retirement from Indian white ball cricket. His last appearance in limited overs cricket came in the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2024-25.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
